title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message: Water damaged 820-00239. Replaced U3100 and U2890 along with all resistors and caps in that area and a few jumper wires. Suck at 5v at 0amp on all usb c ports. I do have PP3V3_G3H.

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message: Possible broken trace, lost connection with U2800...

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message: Thats not what i was hoping to hear. Sounds like even more of a nightmare then its already been.

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message:
U2890 connects to U2800 and U3200 with some traces inside PCB.
I trashed one board for this issue some time ago...

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message: So i actually got it to boot. After testing and comparing diode readings to another board it looks like U3200 wasn't getting PP3V3_G3H but the rest of the board was so after one more jumper wire we have 20v and it boots!!!!!. But its a 2016 so its got flexgate.... time to call the customer and tell them something I'm sure they already know but failed to mention....

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message: Oh and Critical update failed. Even better

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message: You are lucky getting experience at least; in case the client retires it without finishing the repair.

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message: Alright so digging into the critical update issue. Ran diode mode on both touch bar connectors and compared to a know good board. found a I had a broken line to pin 20 and 21 on J4402 for the touch bar ran yet another jumper but still getting error. Testing with a known good display and top case and USB OS. SSD can be accessed with lifeboat in place.

title: 820-00239 stuck at 5v 0amp
message:
Few posts on the forum refer to this issue.
We didn't get feedback if any works; just try...
